nodes.message: Office Door usually does not open
Gerhard not in office, door is securely locked and trapped
Door is open so Shawn can give ledger to Gerhard
Gerhard is never available for an event on test days and free days.
Gerhard has an event for player

nodes.text: The plaque on the door says, "Master von Urwald."
The small sign next to the door says, "The Instructor Is In."
The little sign says, "Meeting in Progress - Do not Disturb."
So... what do you suppose the Master is saying to Sosi?
Pity this door is so thick... I'd love to listen in on that meeting.
I hate this door.
The sign next to the door says, "The Instructor is Out."
There's an odd sort of lock on this door... I'll bet there's a trap.
The door is locked. Not very trusting, is he?
You may enter.
I hope that the Master isn't staying late in his office...
<knock> Knock, knock!
Good. It would be embarrassing to break in on him.
I guess the Master isn't in his office right now.
I think this trap is something special and the master is trying to send us all a message. I'll need to find another way around this door.
Okay, I can definitely see that there is a trap set in the locking mechanism...
No trap that I can see here. Of course, I could be wrong.
Time to put this trusty ol' Trap Tapper to work.
I'm not going anywhere near that trap until I've got something that'll help me disarm it.
There's definitely magic here trapping this door! Isn't that cheating for a Rogue to use magic?
Come to think of it, I guess not.
It feels like it is the magic that is sealing the door rather than the lock. If that's so, then why bother to lock it?
Unless, of course, you are a devious and duplicitous Rogue instructor who wants to make his students suffer.
Yep, it's still magical.

nodes.message: As per design Shawn will always fail the trap

nodes.text: I think this trap is something special and the master is trying to send us all a message. Since the Trap Tapper didn't disarm it, I'll need to find another way around this door!
This lock should be easy enough to pick.
There, got it!
Drat.
Wait... what?
If only I had the tools to pick a lock...
I hope this works... I'm really sick of this door.
What do you know? The key fits this lock... Now if only I can turn the key without setting off the trap.
I hope this works...
What do you know? The key fits this lock... Let's see what happens when I try to turn the key - Hope there are no nasty surprises.
Yes! It worked. Now let's see whether that Raven statue is really hidden in Gerhard's office...

nodes.message: Change to Music Track used in Break-In to Gerhard's Office

nodes.text: I don't hear anything... but judging from the way this door is built, there could be a brass band playing on the other side and I wouldn't hear anything through it.
Yiiiikkkkessss!
That's not fair! I successfully disarmed the trap.
Don't tell me that the Master cheated by putting a Trap-Tapper-proof trap on his door!   Guess I'll need to find another way to open it.
Why does the Master put a trap on his door? Doesn't he trust us?
Ouch... That door's got one helluva kick!
This is making me angry. And sore, very sore.
Let's see if I can disarm it...
Aha, I got it! I've outsmarted the master! That'll teach him to teach me how to disarm traps.
Uh oh...
Maybe this isn't the best idea I've ever had...
Now if only I had a way to disarm traps...
